meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface or area.
meanings.sent1: She was strewing flowers along the path to create a colorful trail.
meanings.sent2: The wind was strewing leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was strewing acorns around the garden for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was strewing joy in the room like confetti.
meanings.sent5: The artist was strewing paint on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Cover (a surface or area) with untidily scattered things.
meanings.sent1: He was strewing his toys all over the living room floor.
meanings.sent2: The kids were strewing sand on the beach while building sandcastles.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was strewing his toys everywhere in the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm was strewing debris across the neighborhood like a giant broom.
meanings.sent5: The chef was strewing herbs on the dish, adding a burst of flavor.
